headline.main: DIET DRUG CURBS EXPECTED SOON; Goddard Says F.D.A. Has Enough Evidence to Act

byline.original: By HAROLD M. SCHMECK Jr.Special to The New York Times

docs.abstract: hearing; Comr Goddard says FDA now has enough evidence after many yrs to act soon to drive from mkt certain combinations of drugs, eg, thyroid hormone and digitalis, widely used to control obesity; cites recent seizures, plans more
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 -- For the first time, the Food and Drug Administration is confident it has enough evidence to act soon to drive from the market certain combinations of prescription drugs widely used to control overweight.
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 -- For the first time, the Food and Drug Administration is confident it has enough evidence to act soon to drive from the market certain combinations of prescription drugs widely used to control overweight.

headline.main: Use of Diet Pills Linked to 14 Deaths in Illinois; Coroner Tells Senate Panel Victims Are Usually Young Medical Officer in Oregon Cites 6 Deaths in His State

docs.abstract: hearing; Illinois coroner and Ore med exec blame diet pills for some deaths in their states; Hart sees danger in current treatment
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 (AP)--An Illinois coroner testified today that diet pills were suspected as the cause of what he said was the sudden and unexpected death of 14 persons in his state, most of them young people.
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 (AP)--An Illinois coroner testified today that diet pills were suspected as the cause of what he said was the sudden and unexpected death of 14 persons in his state, most of them young people.
